channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Consistent fly tipping causing rat infestation, 18th January
item.description:
End of Prince of orange lane has consistent fly tipping which is causing rat infestation in surrounding properties. This has been repeated previously, rubbish has been left here since September and still no action taken. Please remove it asap.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwich High Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin and fly tipping, 18th January
item.description:
A lot of the bins on Edith Road are overflowing and rubbish is all over the pavements. This bin is especially overflowing and people have started to fly tip next to it. Please can someone come and empty the bins on this long road and tidy up. Also noticed that some inner linings of bins are too high for the bin opening so you cannot fit rubbish in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 18th January
item.description:
Car has been abandoned in this location for 2 months. It is not able to be moved, looks like it was stolen and written off and then abandoned

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenesk Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 18th January
item.description:
This pothole appeared less than two weeks ago and has gradually got bigger. There is gravel all over the round which is dangerous for cyclists,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radbourne Road, Streatham Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anti social behaviour and poor pavement management have ruined local amenities, 18th January
item.description:
The bus stop area around Bird in Hand Lane, has been turned into an eyesore with obvious anti social behaviour. The Council have done nothing to remodel this area to ensure it did not turn into an eyesore that it is now. At one point prior to the new school being built young local children used to plant spring bulb - nothing will grow there now where it is trampled to mud patches. Its fairly obvious Bullers Wood School and Bromley Council need to take some responsibility & accountability and remodel this area so there is some mutual amenities for everyone to enjoy benefit.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bickley Road, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Could a littler bin be place next to the Foot Cray Meadows exit oppsite Cray Youth Centre?, 18th January
item.description:
Could a littler bin be place next to the Foot Cray Meadows exit opposite Cray Youth Centre? There is no bin near this popular exit to the Meadows and people are leaving bags of rubbish by the dog poo bin. Unfortunately the local wildlife rip these bags apart and the litter blows around the meadows.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Lane, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Decomposing food waste dumped on Mill Street public pavement â€“ health and pest risk, 18th January
item.description:
Food waste has been dumped on the public pavement at this location (a tucked away corner between Unit 1 and Unit 2 on Mill Street) and has been present for approximately two weeks. The waste is actively decomposing and attracting pests, creating a public health and hygiene risk for pedestrians, nearby premises, and local wildlife animals. Surrounding leaf litter was recently cleared, but the food waste was left behind and continues to deteriorate. Due to the length of time the waste has been present and the increasing risk of pest infestation and contamination, urgent street cleansing and Environmental Health attention is requested.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Mill Street, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Persistent dumping of rubbish outside a HMO at 15 Aldeburgh Street attracting vermin, 18th January
item.description:
Huge dump of rubbish outside 15 Aldeburgh Street including food waste attracting vermin. The house is an HMO and constantly overloading bins, leaving rubbish outside and creating opportunities for foxes and rats.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Aldeburgh Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
